channel.title: Add more revisions for the server status
channel.description:
I suggest you guys add more revision choices for the server status list or just allow us to input our own revision instead of a drop-down menu of revisions.
https://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php

item.title: Add more revisions for the server status
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:73, topic:544239”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=663120.msg4435398#msg4435398 date=1404934904]
So right now it doesn’t do anything special with the revision, but I’d still like to keep it a dropdown instead of a free text field.
[/quote]Good. I don’t know about any of you, but it’d be pretty bothersome to see a 317 PI leech listed as a 8636373 revision.[/quote]It still happens regardless?

Read full topic
item.source: Add more revisions for the server status

item.title: Add more revisions for the server status
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:46, topic:544239”]So right now it doesn’t do anything special with the revision, but I’d still like to keep it a dropdown instead of a free text field.[/quote]Good. I don’t know about any of you, but it’d be pretty bothersome to see a 317 PI leech listed as a 8636373 revision.

Read full topic
item.source: Add more revisions for the server status

item.title: Add more revisions for the server status
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:63, topic:544239”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=663120.msg4436464#msg4436464 date=1405205606]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=663120.msg4436456#msg4436456 date=1405204640]

Why dont you guys just drop revisions and have servers declare themselves as ‘Classic’, ‘Oldschool’, ‘Modern’, and ‘EOC’. Simple. K. Done.
[/quote]Because everyone different ideas of what ‘oldschool’ and ‘modern’ are

Err, modern would be anything above 500 (HD graphics) and oldschool would be classified as by what oldschool current looks like.
[/quote]If it was clarified in the drop down like
Oldschool (XXX-500)
Modern (500-XXX)
EOC (###+)
then it might work.

But even then I think it’s a bad idea, there are huge difference between revisions in those eras. Some people like HD but not claws (500-525), some like old graphics but not godwars items (474?) etc.[/quote]
Rune-Server labels 503+ as “modern - EOC”

Read full topic
item.source: Add more revisions for the server status

item.title: Add more revisions for the server status
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Toplist could use a bit of a rework. We can all agree on that.

Read full topic
item.source: Add more revisions for the server status

item.title: Add more revisions for the server status
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

If Moparisthebest agrees to it I will work on the details feature, at least HTML/CSS sided. I can’t guarantee it will look good (or be quality code), I am not a skilled web developer and I suck at anything artsy.

Read full topic
item.source: Add more revisions for the server status

item.title: Add more revisions for the server status
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

These ideas and what not are all great, but who’s going to take time out of their life to write and implement them? That’s the downfall of MoparScape, we all have good ideas now and again but they sink and die because no one is motivated enough or has enough free time to write them. It’s a shame, really.

Read full topic
item.source: Add more revisions for the server status

item.title: Add more revisions for the server status
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Yea I added the ability to search by details would be beneficial as well Honestly the thumbs up/down thing needs to be checked better somehow. I know people were abusing it. Maybe make it once per day per ip or something, idk.

As for comments, it just makes it really hard to moderate and isn’t really worth it. Maybe require each post to have a forum thread and link them somehow. If we remove the forum thread it removes from the SSP?

Read full topic
item.source: Add more revisions for the server status

item.title: Add more revisions for the server status
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:66, topic:544239”]This might sound crazy as shit, but what if instead of having a dropdown like that at all, we had a like a ‘Details’ tooltip.

For instance:

Registration page:
Title: __________
IP/Port: ________
Era: _____ (sinisoul’s idea)
Details:
(insert big list of checkboxes, they can check at most like 5 or 10)
Expanded details:
(same as current details, accepts bb code etc, displayed when they actually click the server)

Example detail checkboxes could be…
Grand Exchange
High Detail
Multiple Worlds
EOC
PvP World
Skilling Server
Spawning
etc

Now when someone hovers over their server in the status page (or hovers over a ‘details’ button or w/e for each server), a little box pops up displaying the details the owner selected. Think of like an image preview when you hover over a thumbnail.

Thoughts?[/quote]

If you add stuff like that (which I am not against I like this idea) We should be able to organize the servers by those features. And I think it would help a lot to have a star rating instead of thumbs up thumbs down sort of thing. Or show how many bad votes are for a server too. I just think people cheat with the thumbs up thing.

I like the fact that we have a forum part of the server status, but I do think being able to comment on a server would be beneficial too. Limit each comment to like 140 characters so they are short and to the point.

Read full topic
item.source: Add more revisions for the server status

item.title: Add more revisions for the server status
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

This might sound crazy as shit, but what if instead of having a dropdown like that at all, we had a like a ‘Details’ tooltip.

For instance:

Registration page:
Title: __________
IP/Port: ________
Era: _____ (sinisoul’s idea)
Details:
(insert big list of checkboxes, they can check at most like 5 or 10)
Expanded details:
(same as current details, accepts bb code etc, displayed when they actually click the server)

Example detail checkboxes could be…
Grand Exchange
Multiple Worlds
PvP World
High Detail (overlaps with era, but its still something that could be useful)
Skilling Server
Spawning
etc

Now when someone hovers over their server in the status page (or hovers over a ‘details’ button or w/e for each server), a little box pops up displaying the details the owner selected. Think of like an image preview when you hover over a thumbnail. This will allow people to search by these details as well.

Thoughts?

Read full topic
item.source: Add more revisions for the server status

item.title: Add more revisions for the server status
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I agree with sinisoul. Moving to qualitative naming would certainly make the page more maintainable for Moparisthebest and more user-friendly too.
Some information could be provided about what each qualitative name means.

Anyway, I don’t think version numbers are really indicative of content these days. With all of the shit that people hack into their clients and so on.

Read full topic
item.source: Add more revisions for the server status

item.title: Add more revisions for the server status
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Listing builds is a bit ridiculous considering there are over 800, if people are looking for specifics like that they should read the description. The major differences in RSPSs are definitely the graphics and the MAJOR combat rework. You might as well introduce some clarity as to how theyre classified.

Read full topic
item.source: Add more revisions for the server status

item.title: Add more revisions for the server status
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:57, topic:544239”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=663120.msg4435640#msg4435640 date=1405004830]

So right now it doesn’t do anything special with the revision, but I’d still like to keep it a dropdown instead of a free text field.

So what about the real subject at hand. Adding more revisions to that dropdown.

I’d love to! Still waiting for a list of ones to add though!

edit:
Ok, I’ve taken a certain suggestion from above and now the list of revisions is this:

317,377,459,474,488,498,508,525,562,602,604,634,637,639,666,667,668,669,670,681,696,697,698,714,718,719

Any more needed?
[/quote]
You might want to remove some of them now that I think about it.

Here’s the revisions that come to mind to me:
317, 377, 459, 474, 498, 508, 517, 525, 562, 602, 604, 634, 637, 639, 666, 667, 718, 742, 752, 803.

Pretty much all the most common ones.[/quote]
377 has no point in being in there either.
459 and 498 aren’t that popular, I’ve seen at most 5 projects use that revision (at most).
517, literally no one uses.

Read full topic
item.source: Add more revisions for the server status

Pretty much all the most common ones.

item.title: Add more revisions for the server status
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:55, topic:544239”]He doesn’t seem hostile just because he’s questioning why to do it, ranger squad. The search functionality question was well placed and everything else stated was fine.

I’d suggest just making the necessary changes.[/quote]

“We already have a ‘protocol blacklist’.”

“I’d still like to keep it a dropdown instead of a free text field.”

I’d suggest that you don’t be a dick, it impresses no one.

Read full topic
item.source: Add more revisions for the server status

item.title: Add more revisions for the server status
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

He doesn’t seem hostile just because he’s questioning why to do it, ranger squad. The search functionality question was well placed and everything else stated was fine.

I’d suggest just making the necessary changes.

Read full topic
item.source: Add more revisions for the server status

item.title: Add more revisions for the server status
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:53, topic:544239”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=663120.msg4435689#msg4435689 date=1405011928]

So right now it doesn’t do anything special with the revision, but I’d still like to keep it a dropdown instead of a free text field.

So what about the real subject at hand. Adding more revisions to that dropdown.

I’d love to! Still waiting for a list of ones to add though!

edit:
Ok, I’ve taken a certain suggestion from above and now the list of revisions is this:

317,377,459,474,488,498,508,525,562,602,604,634,637,639,666,667,668,669,670,681,696,697,698,714,718,719

Any more needed?

Why not have it as a dropdown with the option for a user to add their own?

That would require a code change, it limits entries to a defined set. Also, how would the search functionality work then?

Check it’s numeric, check that it’s between 194 and whatever the current version is.

[/quote]

And the current version is ?

I’m open to someone making the necessary code changes on github and sending them to me! :)[/quote]

Current version is 813. I’ll take a look into making the changes if it will be implemented but you seem pretty hostile to it at the moment so I’m not sure if it’s worth it or not.

Read full topic
item.source: Add more revisions for the server status
